posts.post_content: The people complaining that when it dies, "all the damage is undone" are missing the point. You don't remove their stuff, you remove your stuff. You remove your Broodmate Dragon and let them decide between dealing with one 6/6 flier or two 4/4 fliers. Or you remove your allies and kill the angel yourself to get their comes into play abilities to trigger off each other. Or you remove all your own plainswalkers right before you play a Warp World. Plus, it's a 6/6 flier for 6.

posts.post_content:
Ramp to 6 mana with [Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow) and [Noble Heirarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Heirarch) / [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), drop this, and the turn after, drop [Realm Razer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Realm Razer) and a land. Watch your opponent cry. (And maybe respond with their [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate), but still.) More fun if [Steppe Lynx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steppe Lynx) and [Plated Geopede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plated Geopede) are around.  
  
Despite being a gigantic removal target, I absolutely adore this thing. I cross my fingers that I pick up one or maybe even two at the prerelease events this weekend. Yes, it dies to removal; so does everything. But being [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring) on a stick is just too good to ignore.
posts.html:
Ramp to 6 mana with Harrow and Noble Heirarch / Birds of Paradise, drop this, and the turn after, drop Realm Razer and a land. Watch your opponent cry. (And maybe respond with their Terminate, but still.) More fun if Steppe Lynx and Plated Geopede are around.

Despite being a gigantic removal target, I absolutely adore this thing. I cross my fingers that I pick up one or maybe even two at the prerelease events this weekend. Yes, it dies to removal; so does everything. But being Oblivion Ring on a stick is just too good to ignore.

It is too bad that the casting cost isn't ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) instead, like an equivalent [Rampaging Baloths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampaging Baloths).

Posted By: Giondi (1/31/2010 7:29:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I can spend my first three to four turns frantically ramping, dieing to all sorts of spells, and then it happens I get my salvation, one of my big landfally creature cards, it tap my six and smile triumphantly as I lay down my giant angel. I play Marsh Flats and slay one creature, and the swamp I bring in fells another, I p\*\*\* the turn to my wrecked opponent staring down a 6/6 flier.  
Then he casts one of his 8 instant speed removal spells, and all damage was undone, when I could of just played a finisher that left something behind if it dies like Ranger into Scute Mob/Dragomaster. Or Rampaging Baloth's two tokens.  
  
You don't wanna say dies to removal, but in the deck it was 'designed' for it's just asking for disaster when you could play the sure thing.
